meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Roger Werries Lisa Dixon Danielle Yermish Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #4006.

td.p: Roger Werries, a computer forensics instructor from Bowie, Maryland
Lisa Dixon, a claim representative from Peachtree City, Georgia
Danielle Yermish, an elementary school teacher from Los Angeles, California (whose 1-day cash winnings total $3,400)

tr.td: ORGANIZATIONS
FILMS OF THE '80s
(Alex: We want you to name the river in...)
A RIVER RUNS THROUGH THEM
"MARK"DOWN
(Alex: "Mark" in quotation...marks.)
PLUS TAX
(Alex: Of course.)

tr.td: Danielle
Lisa
Roger
A GOOD "ST"ART
THERE'S NO PLACE LIKE ROME
INTERNATIONAL SPORTS
SCIENCE CLASS
AMERICAN LIT
HYMNS

(Roger: What is the blood of Jesus?)
(Alex: No.)
---

the blood of the lamb

LisaRoger
Triple Stumper
')

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_1_5', 'clue_DJ_1_5_stuck', '(Roger: I will risk $1,430.)
(Alex: There must be a significance to that. What is it?)
(Roger: There is. Something between me and my wife.)
[Laughter.]
(Alex: There are no secrets on "Jeopardy!)
---
(Roger: [Shakes head, no response.])
(Alex: Correct response, What is [*]? [*] fluoride. Minute to go, and the secret between you and your wife remains safe for the time being.)

stannous

Roger
')

And so we have credited Roger with the amount of money we took away from him and credited him with a correct response.)

(Alex: [To Roger.] I bet you risked $1,430. I was right! Hey! And you wind up with $7,740, and you get to come back. Perhaps we will find out his secret tomorrow!)
